meanings.definition: To look closely or carefully at something.
meanings.sent1: She likes to prys at the tiny details in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: He always prys at the map before starting a journey.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to prys at the mysterious letter for clues.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes prys at the hidden message in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used a magnifying glass to prys at the tiny insect.

meanings.definition: To try to force something open.
meanings.sent1: He tried to prys open the stuck window with a screwdriver.
meanings.sent2: The burglar attempted to prys the lock on the door.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat managed to prys open the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: She had to prys open the rusty old chest to see what was inside.
meanings.sent5: The children used a stick to prys open the stubborn door.

meanings.definition: To set a value on something.
meanings.sent1: They prys the antique vase at a high price during the auction.
meanings.sent2: The appraiser will prys the rare coin at the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly prys his friendship with a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent4: She prys her memories as priceless treasures.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler will prys the diamond ring before making an offer.
